授業目的: The purpose of this course is for students to learn about ageing societies and how they affect the economy, health care, social services, women and families, paid workers, communities, and future opportunities for young people in Canada and Japan.
到達目標:
Students will:
• Understand why Canada and Japan are ageing so quickly and how this affects all parts of society including young people
• Discuss current issues in ageing societies including rising health and social care costs; the changing role of women and family caregivers; foreign workers; the use of robots and technology to care for older persons; the design of age-friendly and dementia-friendly communities; doctor-assisted death; and future opportunities for young people in Canada and Japan
• Learn how to write and present short “briefing notes” on key issues.
授業方法: Learning activities include lectures by the Professor, student discussions and short student-led presentations. The Professor's presentation will be available on LUNA before each course session to make it easier for students to understand and take notes.

評価.成績評価Grading4:
備考　Note
Students will write two short (1000–1200 words) “briefing notes” on course topics of their choice. A briefing note gives the reader a basic understanding of a selected topic (e.g., family caregivers) and what government is doing about it (e.g., family caregivers are given paid time off work). Sources can include short media reports and other credible on-line sources (e.g., the World Health Organization). Each student will also give a short (5-10 minute) in-class presentation on a course topic of their choice; students may chose the same topic covered in a one of their two written briefing notes (e.g., family caregivers). Students will also receive marks for attendance and active participation.

Briefing Note 1: 20%
Briefing Note 2: 30%
Short In-Class Presentation: 30%
Attendance & Participation: 20%
